Title: e2fsprogs: Heap-based buffer overflow
Synopsis:
A heap-based buffer overflow in e2fsprogs might allow local
    attackers to execute arbitrary code.

Background.Text: e2fsprogs is a set of utilities for maintaining the ext2, ext3 and ext4 file systems.

Description.Text: A heap-based buffer overflow was discovered in openfs.c in the libext2fs library in e2fsprogs.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to use ext2fs library (for example, fsck) on a specially crafted Ext2/3/4 file system possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All e2fsprogs users should upgrade to the latest version:
